snippet: Prime Minister Pedro Passos Coelho’s two-party coalition won almost 39 percent of the vote, according to preliminary results, ahead of the main opposition Socialist party, which got 32 percent.
abstract: Center-right coalition of Portuguese Prime Min Pedro Passos Coelho wins re-election, although it fails to retain parliamentary majority; election is widely viewed as bellwether for austerity measures pushed upon country by creditors due to euro crisis.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Pedro Passos Coelho’s two-party coalition won almost 39 percent of the vote, according to preliminary results, ahead of the main opposition Socialist party, which got 32 percent.

headline.main: Center-Right Coalition That Applied Austerity Measures Is Re-elected in Portugal
headline.print_headline: Center-Right Coalition That Applied Austerity Measures Is Re-elected in Portugal
